meaningMnemonic: If you want to <radical>say</radical> how big a <radical>cross</radical> is, you have to <kanji>measure</kanji> it. You can't say the size of something without measuring it first.
readingMnemonic: You need to <kanji>measure</kanji> this cross but all you have is a <reading>ca</reading>ke (けい). Good enough! I'm sure all cakes are exactly the same size, so they're a reliable unit of measure.
